meanings.definition: Ramies: plural form of ramie, a plant of the nettle family with fibrous stems used for making textiles.
meanings.sent1: The farmer harvested the ramies to create soft fabrics.
meanings.sent2: She wore a beautiful dress made of ramies to the party.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to knit a sweater using ramies from the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity bloomed as she weaved stories into the ramies of her tapestry.
meanings.sent5: The fields swayed with the whisper of ramies, promising comfort in their threads.

meanings.definition: Ramies: a fabric made from the fibers of the ramie plant.
meanings.sent1: The store displayed a variety of ramies for sale.
meanings.sent2: He preferred the durability of ramies for his clothing.
meanings.sent3: The cat curled up on the soft ramies, purring contently.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as light and airy as the touch of ramies.
meanings.sent5: The gentle touch of ramies against her skin brought a sense of calm.
